column7: この段落を読み終えたら、次のページをめくってください。

column9: Kono danraku o yomioeta ra, tsugi no pēji o mekutte kudasai.

column7: 少しの息抜きが必要だ。
column8: I need a little rest.
column9: Sukoshi no ikinuki ga hitsuyō da.

column8: I did research on that topic.
column9: Sono tēma ni tsuite risāchi o okonatta.

column7: 電気を節約することは大切だ。
column8: It's important to save electricity.
column9: Denki o setsuyaku suru koto wa taisetsu da.

column7: 毎月倹約して貯金を増やしている。
column8: I economize every month and increase my savings.
column9: Mai tsuki ken'yaku shite chokin o fuyashite iru.

column9: Karera no deai wa unmei datta.

column7: 彼は足跡を辿って探し続けた。

column7: この問題は単純だ。
column8: This problem is simple.

column7: 彼の意見は極端すぎる。
column8: His opinion is too extreme.
column9: Kare no iken wa kyokutan sugiru.

column7: 彼は素晴らしい職人だ。

column9: Korāgen wa hada ni yoi seibun toshite shirarete iru.

column8: The board meeting is scheduled to start at 10 AM.
column9: Torishimariyaku kai wa gozen 10-ji ni hajimaru yotei da.

column8: He ran up to the scene of the accident.
column9: Kare wa jiko no genba ni kakeyotta.
column10: Used when running towards something, often with urgency.

column7: 背後から声が聞こえた。
column8: I heard a voice from behind.
column9: Haigo kara koe ga kikoeta.
column10: Refers to the back or rear, often used in the context of a hidden action.

column8: I have encountered a molester.
column9: Chikan ni sōgū shita koto ga aru.
column10: Refers to a person who molests others, often in public.

column7: 彼は新しいプロジェクトに取り組んでいる。
column8: He is tackling a new project.
column9: Kare wa atarashī purojekuto ni torikunde iru.
column10: Refers to tackling or dealing with something seriously.

column9: Kono atarashī shisutemu wa raigetsu dōnyū sareru yotei da.

column8: His will is firm, and he is unaffected by anything.

column7: この町は活気に満ちている。
column8: This town is full of energy.

column10: Refers to a lively or energetic atmosphere.

column7: 自分の義務を果たさなければならない。
column8: I must fulfill my duty.

column7: 彼は塾に通っている。
column8: He goes to a cram school.

column8: He was leaning over the desk.
column9: Kare wa tsukue no ue ni karada o noshikakete ita.
column10: Refers to leaning or bending over something.

column7: 山の頂上に突出した岩が見える。
column8: You can see a protruding rock at the top of the mountain.
column9: Yama no chōjō ni tokkutsu shita iwa ga mieru.

column7: チームは緊密に連携して問題を解決した。
column8: The team worked closely together to solve the problem.
column9: Chīmu wa kinmitsu ni renkei shite mondai o kaiketsu shita.
column10: Refers to coordination or collaboration.

column7: 彼は壁に寄り掛かって休んでいる。
column8: He is leaning against the wall, resting.
column9: Kare wa kabe ni yorikakatte yasunde iru.
column10: Used when leaning or reclining on something.

column7: 木の枝が風で揺らいでいる。
column8: The branches of the tree are swaying in the wind.
column9: Ki no eda ga kaze de yurande iru.
column10: Refers to shaking, swaying, or swinging back and forth.

column7: 試合に負けてがっくりした。
column8: I was disappointed after losing the game.
column9: Shiai ni makete gakkuri shita.

column7: その発明は画期的なものであった。
column8: That invention was revolutionary.

column7: 彼女はいつもおしゃれに着飾っている。
column8: She is always dressed up fashionably.

column10: Refers to dressing up or adorning oneself.

column7: 彼は高くジャンプした。
column8: He jumped high.

column7: 映画のシナリオは非常に面白かった。
column8: The movie's script was very interesting.

column7: 彼に割り当てられた仕事は難しい。
column8: The task assigned to him was difficult.
column9: Kare ni wariaté rareta shigoto wa muzukashī.
column10: Refers to being assigned a task or responsibility.

column7: 彼はろくに食事を取らない。
column8: He doesn't eat properly.

column8: I plan to go on a trip during the consecutive holidays.
column9: Renkyū ni ryokō ni iku yotei da.

column7: 彼は広大な領地を持っている。
column8: He owns vast territory.
column9: Kare wa kōdaina ryōchi o motte iru.
column10: Refers to land or territory owned by someone.

column7: その国は広大な領土を有している。
column8: The country possesses vast territory.
column9: Sono kuni wa kōdaina ryōdo o yūshite iru.
column10: Refers to a country's land or jurisdiction.

column5: one thing or another/to be apt to do/anyhow

column8: I'm so busy with one thing or another that I can't rest.

column8: This does not meet the requirements.
column9: kono jouken ni wa gaitou shimasen.

column8: The phone rang in the middle of the meeting.

column8: It's not such a big problem.

column8: He does not have the authority to make that decision.
